Name: primary syphilis
Definition: A syphilis that is the first stage of syphilis

Name: secondary syphilis
Definition: A syphilis that is characterized as the second stage of syphilis which appears from 2 to 6 months after primary infection
Synonym: secondary syphilis of viscera or bone

Name: tertiary syphilis
Definition: A syphilis that is characterized as the third stage of syphilis that develops after the disappearance of the secondary symptoms and is marked by ulcers and gummas under the skin and commonly by involvement of the skeletal

Name: latent syphilis
Definition: A syphilis that is characterized as having serologic proof of infection without signs or symptoms of disease.

Name: congenital syphilis
Definition: A syphilis that results_in a multisystem infection in the fetus via the placenta.
